name: Introduction to Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of economics. Topics covered include micro and macroeconomic theory, market structure, supply and demand, and game theory.

name: Microeconomics
description: This course provides an in-depth look into microeconomic theory. Topics covered include demand and supply, consumer behavior, production, cost analysis, and market structure.

name: Macroeconomics
description: This course provides an in-depth look into macroeconomic theory. Topics covered include national income, economic growth, money and banking, fiscal and monetary policy, and public finance.

name: Financial Markets and Institutions
description: This course provides an overview of the role of financial markets and institutions in the economy. Topics include the structure and functioning of major financial markets, financial instruments, and financial institutions.

name: Financial Economics
description: This course provides an in-depth look at the use of economic analysis in the study of financial markets and institutions. Topics include asset pricing, portfolio management, market efficiency, and derivative securities.
